result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Michael Riggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Full Huber, Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by October 19 2022  for report date within 60 days or no later than December 13 2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
Concurrent with: 22CF311

12:11 PM Defendant Jordan Michael Riggs in court.  Attorney Jason D Sanders in court for Jordan Michael Riggs.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads No contest. Court finds the defendant guilty. Court orders 90 days Jail with Full Huber and Diversion, Defendant to contact diversion by October 19 2022 and report no later than December 13 2022. Court costs due December 16 2022.
